item.title: Neglected flytipping and new fly tip, 29th July
item.description:
A double bed was dumped on Gilton road over two weeks ago it has been set alight and damaged others property despite being reported by more than one person it appears as dealt with on Lewisham love clean streets. IT HAS NOT BEEN. Further to this within a cars length of this five black bags of garden waste have been left in the road on 28th evening or twenty ninth early morning of July.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gilton Road, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Garden and other waste dumped, 29th July
item.description:
Rubbish is dumped here daily, particularly plastic waste and glass. It's a risk to people and animals. A few extra bins at either end of Beanacre close would help to reduce littering

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Beanacre Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Bug pile of clothes dumped at top of Kingswood Road, 29th July
item.description:
Other people have dumped their clothes on the pile which is growing each day. It has been going on for about 3 weeks now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingswood Road, Penge, London

item.title: Fly-Tipping in Our Food/Garden Waste Bin + Missed Collection, 29th July
item.description:
Our green food/garden waste bin (81 Charlton Church Lane) was not collected during yesterday’s scheduled collection (Monday 28th July). The bin was left on the pavement as per council guidelines, but it was missed. To make matters worse, a neighbour has fly-tipped 3 large bags of general waste into our food/garden bin (see attached photos). I’ve had to remove this rubbish myself to avoid contamination, but now our general waste bin is full, and the food waste remains uncollected. This is causing: - Health and hygiene issues (rotting food waste attracting pests). - Unfair disposal burden (we now have extra waste due to others’ fly-tipping). - Repeated problems (our street has ongoing issues with illegal dumping from flats opposite). Request: - Urgently collect the missed food/garden waste (the bin is now uncontaminated). Please advise when this will be so I can put the bin back onto the street - Investigate the fly-tipping (evidence includes a discarded letter with the offender’s address: Ms A Sita, 66b Charlton Church Lane - Take action against repeat offenders and monitor our street for dumping. This is unacceptable—we pay council tax for reliable waste services. Please resolve this promptly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 69, Charlton Church Lane, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
